meanings.definition: The straight-line configuration of three celestial bodies in a gravitational system.
meanings.sent1: During the syzygy, the planets aligned perfectly in a row.
meanings.sent2: A syzygy of the sun, moon, and Earth creates an eclipse.
meanings.sent3: The syzygy of the stars made it look like they were playing connect the dots.
meanings.sent4: The syzygy of the planets resembled a cosmic dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the syzygy of the celestial bodies was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The alignment of celestial bodies in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: The syzygy of the stars formed a perfect line across the night sky.
meanings.sent2: A syzygy occurs when the planets align in a straight line.
meanings.sent3: The syzygy of the constellations looked like a celestial parade.
meanings.sent4: The syzygy of the moon and stars created a stunning visual display.
meanings.sent5: The rare syzygy of the planets was a sight to behold for stargazers.

meanings.definition: The conjunction or opposition of celestial bodies.
meanings.sent1: The syzygy of the planets brought them into close alignment.
meanings.sent2: During the syzygy, the moon can be in opposition to the sun.
meanings.sent3: The syzygy of the stars seemed to create a cosmic standoff.
meanings.sent4: The syzygy of the celestial bodies marked a significant astronomical event.
meanings.sent5: The syzygy of the planets symbolized the celestial forces at play.
